graph

Interface Graph<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGraph, WordGraph

    public interface Graph<T>
    A graph interface
    Author:
    Tom Leaman (thl5@aber.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEdge(T from, T to)
      Adds a connection from one node to another
      void addNode(T elem)
      Adds a node to the graph with no connections
      java.util.List<T> getConnected(T elem)
      Returns the elements connected from elem
      boolean hasNode(T elem)
      Returns true if elem is a node in this graph
      boolean isEdge(T from, T to)
      Returns true if there is a connection from from to to
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if there are no nodes in the graph
      java.util.Set<T> nodeSet()
      Returns all nodes in the graph
      void removeEdge(T from, T to)
      Removes a connection from the graph (if it exists)
      void removeNode(T elem)
      Removes a node from the graph (if it exists)
      int size()
      The number of nodes in this graph
